name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Indianapolis At The Crossing

reviews.text: Let me break up this review into sections as there are different opinions around different parameters.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location:
reviews.title: Couldn't get much better...

reviews.text: Conveniently located close to the freeways and the mall.However right now (Aug 2012) this is in a royal mess due to construction around the 465. Hopefully when the construction is complete this would be more convenient. But till then purely avoidable unless you like sitting in traffic for hours!
reviews.title: Different than other Homewoods

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: Great Location--Just Understand The Setup

reviews.text: The suites are nice. They are designed well and the bed is comfortable. The downsides were spiders in the bathroom and lack of attention to the appliances in the room. The phone had a broken jack so you had to hold it in place if you wanted to use the phone
reviews.title: Your home away from home......

reviews.text: Kudos to Eric and staff for working hard to find me a room that did not smell like smoke. Third time was the charm and much appreciated. Obviously no shortage of scum who ignore "no smoking" policy, so if you are sensitive - you may have trouble here. I can't sleep in an ashtray. But the property - and the room is very nice. It is convenient to where I am working and comfortable. Microwave popcorn is a nice touch. Again - big thanks to the staff for being welcoming and going the extra mile. Much appreciated by this road warrior.
reviews.title: Great customer service

reviews.text: Stayed here one night while in Indy on business, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The location is great - right off of 465, but in a quiet tree-filled area (looks like they cut the property out of a forest). There really isn't anything within walking distance, but they have a shuttle that will take you within a certain radius, and there are a lot of restaurants, shopping (mall), etc. all within a couple miles of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Location, Rate, Food, and Environs

reviews.text: The property is one where they have multiple stand-alone units around the property, each having multiple suites within them...so you need to check in at the front and then drive around the property to park in front of your building. Not a big deal except they didn't seem to have ramps so you had to lug your bags up steps to get into the buildings. You could make it via sidewalk and ramps all the way from the main lobby building but this wasn't practical unless you were dropped off out front and didn't have a car. That was about the only negative thing from the stay, and it was pretty minor.
reviews.title: Amazing! Love the Staff

reviews.text: The main lobby is very nicely decorated, and they do a great job of stocking up for the manager's reception (M-Th evenings) and breakfast every morning. Nice selections, and always kept stocked and clean. The property area is quite nice as well - very pet friendly (plenty of grass and waste bag stands around), plus there's a basketball court with a regulation level hoop and then a smaller one for children to use.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: The rooms were nice and clean with ample sleeping and working space, plus nice flat screen TVs with HD in both the living room area and the bedroom. Well lit, plenty of windows and space to spread out your work and luggage and still get around. The staff across the board are all very competent and friendly - always ready to help out if needed and getting you checked-in and out very efficiently.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here with 2 objectives for a romantic overnight getaway from the kiddos: 1) sleep in a big king-size bed and 2) Go swimming. We got to our room to find a full-size bed, and the front desk said they were sold out of Kings so they just stuck us in this room without letting us know it would be different (even though our reservation was for a king!) And when we went to the pool, there was a sign saying it was closed for an hour. So the next day we got there at 9am when the pool is supposed to open, and guess what?! It's locked, no sign, and we went to the front desk and they told us it would be closed for at least an hour... so we didn't even get to swim!!! Ridiculous!
reviews.title: Bad experience, Worn out hotel

reviews.text: Also, this hotel is wearing out- at the breakfast bar, one of the cabinet doors was missing, so it looked very trashy. And, It was so crowded that my husband and I shared a chair and ate on our lap.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: At the entrance to our section of the hotel, the doors were open to the laundry room, the housekeeping staff were all lined up so you could hardly walk through, and there are HORRIBLE scuff marks all along the bottom of the walls and doors that made it feel like a dump!! Oh, and when you showered, there was 5 inches of standing water because the drain wasn't working properly.
reviews.title: Very Clean and Comfortable! Nice Room Arrangement!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you like nice or new hotels, DON'T STAY HERE!!!
reviews.title: Customer service outstanding, noise level unacceptable

reviews.text: We had an opportunity to take my granddaughter to this facilty last week and found it to be a pleasent experience. The location was perfect, check-in was efficient and the staff was truly friendly. The morning breakfast was substantial and included sufficient selections to please anyone. They also have an evening meal on Monday/Thursday which was better than anticipated.
reviews.title: Very Good, But Need Some Improvements!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our suite at Homewood Suites was clean and recently redecorated; a small issue (desk phone not working) was addressed within 5 minutes of our call to front desk. Very accessible to all the activities we had planned in Indy, great breakfast on Sunday, and a fantastic value for the price! Will definitley come back!
reviews.title: Excellent suite hotel - fantastic value

reviews.text: * did not use pool or spa, but it looked very nice. Only drawback is we had to really look around to find a place for breakfast (we felt like going out that day).
reviews.title: Clean and Quiet

reviews.text: If you are looking for the space provided by a Suites type of hotel, with a full kitchen and room to spread out, this is a solid option. Convenient to I-465 yet very quiet. Nice rooms attentive staff.
reviews.title: excellent service
"non-smoking room" smelled like an ashtray.
reviews.text: check in was fast- location of room great as I have stayed here before.
Very quiet rooms. Clean areas . I had a probem with the remote and just happened to
reviews.title: Great experience...

aka: Homewood Suites By Hilton Indianapolis At The Crossing Hotel
